arts.ttl: Queens Park Rangers 1-2 Sheffield United: Campbell’s Excellent Strike Makes the Difference at Loftus Road
arts.sum: Sheffield United showed their clinical edge in attack and then relied on their resolute defence to beat Queens Park Rangers 2-1 at Loftus Road. The Blades struck early with a header from Ben Brereton Diaz in the tenth minute. arts.ttl: QPR v Sheffield United player ratings
arts.sum: QPR put up in a spirited performance but were beaten 2-1 at Loftus Road by promotion-chasing Sheffield United. Here’s how we rated each Rangers player. Paul Nardi: 5 Had to do better for Sheffield United’s all-important first goal. arts.ttl: Cifuentes ‘proud’ of QPR display in Sheffield United defeat
arts.sum: “It doesn’t matter if you create 20 chances if you’re not able to score. If you create two chances and then score two, you have a lot of possibilities to win the game.

Marti Cifuentes was proud of QPR’s performance in their 2-1 loss at home to Sheffield United but admitted their opponents’ quality in the final third of the pitch proved decisive. Ben Brereton Diaz’s early goal and Tyrese Campbell’s thumping second-half strike put the promotion-chasing Blades two up. Michael Frey gave Rangers hope with a 72nd-minute […] The post Cifuentes ‘proud’ and Wilder praises QPR appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: QPR midfielder Field faces lengthy spell out
arts.sum: QPR midfielder Sam Field faces a lengthy spell on the sidelines. Field suffered an ankle injury in a challenge from Connor Ogilvie in Rangers’ recent defeat at Portsmouth and missed the 2-1 loss at home to Sheffield United. Rangers are still establishing the extent of the injury but he is expected to be out for […] The post QPR midfielder Field faces lengthy spell out appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: The lowdown on QPR 1 Sheffield United 2 - Rangers’ lack of cutting edge proves costly against promotion-chasers
arts.sum: Koki Saito ended up playing at left back, and with Kader Dembele now available again following a long-term knee injury, he came off the bench to end the game as one of two number 10s alongside Ilias Chair as the QPR head coach opted to empty his midfield in search of an equaliser. An impressive performance was not rewarded with any points as QPR failed to make the most of their chances in a defeat that looks to have all but ended their slim hopes of a late-season play-off push.

arts.ttl: Sheff Utd cut Leeds' lead after battling win at QPR
arts.sum: Sheffield United moved to within three points of Sky Bet Championship leaders Leeds following a 2-1 win at QPR.

arts.ttl: Sheffield United cut Leeds’ lead after battling win at QPR
arts.sum: Ben Brereton Diaz and Tyrese Campbell were on target for the Blades.

arts.ttl: QPR v Sheffield United line-ups: Morgan and Colback start, Field out
arts.sum: Kieran Morgan is back in the QPR starting line-up for today’s game at Loftus Road. Morgan and Jack Colback start in midfield, where Rangers are without Sam Field, who misses out with a knock. Lucas Andersen, back in the squad after injury, is on the bench.
